title: Mass (liturgy)
summary: Mass is the main Eucharistic liturgical service in many forms of Western Christianity. The term Mass is commonly used in the Catholic Church,[1] and in the Western Rite Orthodox, and Old Catholic churches. The term is used in some Lutheran churches,[2][3] as well as in some Anglican churches.[4] The term is also used, on rare occasion, by other Protestant churches, such as in Methodism.[5][6]
